Job Title: General Maintenance (TS/SCI with Polygraph Clearance Required)

Location: Aurora, CO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Diversity Statement 

At Fluor, we are proud to design and build projects and careers. This requires teams that are as unique as the projects we execute. We are committed to fostering a work environment that embraces Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DE&I) for all so our employees and stakeholders benefit from the creative solutions derived as a result of embracing differences.

Job Description

*** Must have an active (or ability to obtain and maintain) TS/SCI with CI Polygraph ***

Under general supervision, this position performs technical and general maintenance work on facilities and building equipment, structures, systems and hardware.

 Complete all Work Tasks and PM’s in a safe and timely matter Participate in the daily morning meeting’s with the entire team to discuss the work to be performed as well as a safety topic for that day. Practice safe work habits in everything they do. Participate in weekly hands on training session on various tasks and equipment every Thursday. Ensure STA’s are completed daily before each shift and signed the following day before the next shift begins. Ensure all JSA’s have been read and signed for all tasks that we perform. Assist all service contractors including Otis Elevators, Urban Armor, Tremco, RTS, Cintas, and Unifirst as needed. Complete timecards daily at the end of that shift. Provide Weekly updates to the General Maintenance Supervisor of updates on all Tasks/Projects. Perform as a member of a 16 person Snow removal team which utilizes Trucks, Loaders, Plows, Brooms, Bobcats, and Rock Salt Spreaders. Participate in training for personnel on various pieces of Snow removal equipment including John Deere’s, Bobcats, Front end loaders, Trucks, Plows, Brooms, and Spreaders. Participate in the Fire Extinguisher and Emergency Eyewash station Program which accounts for more than 600 Fire Extinguishers and 38 Eyewash stations site wide. Maintain PM Books for all Inside Maintenance PM’s to include, but not limited to Secure Doors, Raised Floor Inspections, Turnstiles, Shop Equipment, and Building inspections. Perform furniture reconfigurations using five different types of modular furniture using more than a thousand different parts.

Basic Carpentry skills (Drywall, Painting, Carpet)

 Ensure all Personnel have the proper Tools, Equipment, and PPE to perform all tasks. Participate in training sessions on advanced skills such as Framing walls, Installing Drywall, Finishing, Painting, Installing Carpet, Installing ceiling, Raised Floors, Doors, Concrete finishing, and Wood working to assist the general Maintenance personnel in developing their skills. Complete all HRMS, Fluor, and High side mandatory computer based training annually.

Maintain the certification of CPR/AED.

Basic Landscaping such as mowing, trimming, and watering.

Trash and weed control.

Using basic landscaping tools (Labor)

 Must be skilled and knowledgeable in the following areas. Hand Tools, Power Tools, Patching walls, Painting, Floor Tiles, Ceiling Tiles, Hanging Pictures, Laborer, Landscaping, mowing/trimming, and building shelving. Works with the Archibus team to ensure all Assets are accounted for as well accurately identified and recorded. Other task as assigned

Salary Rate: $24.00 to $30.00/hour + Fringe $4.98/hour

Positions covered by the McNamara-O'Hara Service Contract Act or Davis-Bacon Act will comply with the statute requirements.

#Intel

Notice To Candidates

Background checks are carried out as part of any conditional offer made, including (but not limited to & role dependant) education, professional registration, employment, references, passport verifications and Global Watchlist screening.

To Be Considered Candidates

Must be authorized to work in the country where the position is located.

Basic Job Requirements

 A combination of education and directly related experience equal to four (4) years; some locations may have additional or different qualifications in order to comply with local regulations Ability to communicate effectively with audiences that include but are not limited to management, coworkers, clients, vendors, contractors, and visitors Job related technical knowledge necessary to complete the job Ability to attend to detail and work in a time-conscious and time-effective manner

Other Job Requirements

 Must have an active (or ability to obtain and maintain) TS/SCI with CI Polygraph U.S. Citizen

Preferred Qualifications

 High School Diploma or equivalent appropriate General Certificates of Secondary Education or global equivalent preferred Minimum three (3) years of trade school education or global equivalent License(s) and certification(s) as required Knowledge and experience with basic hand tools and test equipment Ability to read and interpret building layouts, system drawings and manufacturers’ equipment specifications Knowledge of standard and specialized maintenance practices Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos Ability to write simple correspondence Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to clients and other employees of the organization Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry

Position Details

Benefits

Fluor is proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to promote employee health, wellness, and financial security. Our offerings include medical, dental and vision plans, EAP, disability coverage, life insurance, AD&D, voluntary benefit plans, 401(k) with a company match, and training and development courses.

Requisition Number

144774BR

 Diverse Workforce 

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by governing law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
